medical_history.chief_complaint: Development of generalized vitiligo after allogeneic bone marrow transplantation (BMT).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Vitiligo developed within 3 months after BMT, with small depigmented macules appearing at the beginning of the third month post-transplantation. The depigmentation spread to involve most of the skin over a period of 1 year.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with multiple myeloma and treated with melphalan and prednisone over 6 months; no history of depigmentary conditions prior to BMT.
medical_history.family_history: Sister has had generalized vitiligo for 20 years; parents free of any skin disease.
